Message.Title: Dell's Revenue and Earnings Dropping Q-To-Q
Message.Msg: Dell is dead money. Especially at today's inflated price due to Goldman Sachs exiting its position for some of its special clients. Everyone knows when one of the 5 largest banks that are too big to fail change their position such as now that the Fed is behind it. Fed clients need to exit this stock at a smaller loss. So Goldman, the World Bank heavyweight, wields its heavy hand to manipulate another stock for the wealthy. All fundamentals point to the fact that Dell will be substantially lower in 3-6 months as losses mount.

Message.Title: Just a pump and dump by the world's finest market manipulator
Message.Msg: bunch of crooks, be wary of their upgrades
LBO is good. Short squeeze is great. Just look at RIMM, GS did a great job squeezing out shorts. That is the way to make money when retail shorts got in with all their cash.

Not to be too picky, coz it sounds like you guys do not work in the industry, there is no "short squeeze" on an issue with 1.74 billion shares outstanding and total short interest of 57.64 million shares. Yes, its a lot of shares short, but only 5% or so of the total outstanding. Short squeezes usually occur where total short interest exceeds 20%. Dell may well rise with the momentum of GS upgrade and a positive bias to tech in the final weeks of the year, but not due to shorts demanding to cover only 5% of the outstanding float, there is more than adequate supply to do that, even IF the entire short interest wanted to cover, which it does not.
